pullrequest.title: World Modeling 1 -- Box and sphere on ground plane

content.raw: I meant that the worlds would be running at the same time in sync step in that use case so it's not really a switch statement. They could definitely be separate files (I think that's what's used in https://github.com/osrf/collision-benchmark/wiki/Simulating-multiple-worlds), but I think the worlds still have to have different names. Having them in separate files vs same file is the same difference as having multiple models in one file or separate files.
content.html: I meant that the worlds would be running at the same time in sync step in that use case so it's not really a switch statement. They could definitely be separate files (I think that's what's used in https://github.com/osrf/collision-benchmark/wiki/Simulating-multiple-worlds), but I think the worlds still have to have different names. Having them in separate files vs same file is the same difference as having multiple models in one file or separate files.
